page.title: 11SOCIAL CONCERNS: The Bins
page.content: When Bury Metropolitan Borough Council considered the new refuse collection system,they had two main aims:- (1) To provide a more efficient and effective service,and (2) To make economies in local authority expenditure. The introduction of the 'wheelie bins' would achieve a more efficient and effective service but would cost a great deal of money.The new system requires fewer crew members on refuse collection vehicles, therefore savings could be made.The savings would pay for the bins and vehicles within a few years.Further,the 'wheelie bins' are lifted hydraulically by the refuse vehicle which reduces the risk of industrial injury. The trial period in Brandlesholme was so succesful,the Council decided to introduce the system across Bury.
